summary.span: 实现此方法可为此事件添加类处理。

span.span: Implement this method to add class handling for this event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 事件显示为以冒泡路线旅行，但实际以间接方式传播。The event appears to travel a bubbling route but actually travels in an indirect way. 是冒泡路由的基础事件，事件路由中的每个 使用相同的处理来引发直接路由事件 。 is the underlying event that is bubble routed, and each along the event route uses identical handling to raise the direct routed event . 虽然您可以将 事件标记为为此元素的目的进行处理，但已处理状态并不会与事件路由中的其他元素保持。Although you can mark the event as handled for purposes of this element, the handled state does not perpetuate to other elements along the event route. 但是，你可能需要将事件标记为已处理，以防止调用常规实例处理程序（未指定 `handledEventsToo`）。However, you might want to mark the event as handled in order to prevent general instance handlers (those that did not specify `handledEventsToo`) from being invoked. 中的常规鼠标事件处理的默认实现侦听 并将其转换为适当的本地事件。The default implementation for general mouse event handling in listens for and converts it to an appropriate local event. 如果要重写此逻辑，必须创建派生类。If you want to override this logic, you must create a derived class. 在派生类的静态构造函数中，为 注册替代类处理程序。In the static constructor of your derived class, register an alternative class handler for . 不能通过重写 更改 的鼠标处理行为。You cannot change the mouse handling behavior of by overriding . 或者，您可以重写此方法，以便为特定的鼠标状态更改事件处理。Alternatively, you can override this method in order to change event handling for a specific mouse state. 是否选择调用基实现取决于方案。Whether you choose to call the base implementation depends on your scenario. 如果无法调用 base，则会禁用上级类上对该鼠标事件的默认输入处理，这也会要求调用 。Failing to call base disables default input handling for that mouse event on ancestor classes that also expect to invoke . 例如，你可以在派生类中派生 和重写 ，而无需调用基实现;但是，此替代禁用 事件。For example, you can derive from and override in your derived class without calling the base implementation; however, this override disables the event. 在 .NET Framework 版本3.5 中引入。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法没有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 因为继承中的中间类可能实现此方法，所以建议您在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 此方法的目的类似于 \* 方法上的 [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] 事件模式：此方法提供了通过建立类处理程序而不是实例处理程序来处理来自派生类的匹配事件的方法。The purpose of this method is similar to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event pattern On\* methods: this method provides the means to handle the matching event from derived classes by establishing a class handler instead of an instance handler. 在这种情况下，匹配事件是路由事件。In this case the matching event is a routed event. 对于路由事件，On \* 方法的实现模式是不同的，因为路由事件可以由子元素引发，这不一定是将调用处理程序的元素。The implementation pattern of the On\* methods is different for routed events because a routed event can be raised by a child element, which is not necessarily the element that will invoke handlers. 因此，您的实现需要检查事件数据的源属性。Therefore, your implementation needs to examine the source properties of the event data. 大多数情况下，它不应尝试 reraise 该事件。It should not try to reraise the event in most cases. 通过重写此方法或使用 注册类处理程序， 的派生类可以在事件路由收到事件时调用私有类处理程序方法。Either by overriding this method or by registering class handlers with , derived classes of can call private class handler methods when the event is received along the event route. 适用于类处理的一种情况是操作事件数据，并将路由事件标记为 "已处理"。One scenario where class handling is appropriate is to manipulate the event data and mark the routed event as handled. 在 .NET Framework 版本3.5 中引入。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies).

summary.span: 当某个未处理的 路由事件在其路由中到达派生自此类的某个元素时调用。

span.span: Invoked when an unhandled routed event reaches an element in its route that is derived from this class.

summary.span: 实现此方法可为此事件添加类处理。

span.span: Implement this method to add class handling for this event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 事件显示为以冒泡路线旅行，但实际以间接方式传播。The event appears to travel a bubbling route but actually travels in an indirect way. 是冒泡路由的基础事件，事件路由中的每个 使用相同的处理来引发直接路由事件 。 is the underlying event that is bubble routed, and each along the event route uses identical handling to raise the direct routed event . 虽然您可以将 事件标记为为此元素的目的进行处理，但已处理状态并不会与事件路由中的其他元素保持。Although you can mark the event as handled for purposes of this element, the handled state does not perpetuate to other elements along the event route. 但是，你可能需要将事件标记为已处理，以防止调用常规实例处理程序（未指定 `handledEventsToo`）。However, you might want to mark the event as handled in order to prevent general instance handlers (those that did not specify `handledEventsToo`) from being invoked. 中的常规鼠标事件处理的默认实现侦听 并将其转换为适当的本地事件。The default implementation for general mouse event handling in listens for and converts it to an appropriate local event. 如果要重写此逻辑，必须创建派生类。If you want to override this logic, you must create a derived class. 在派生类的静态构造函数中，为 注册替代类处理程序。In the static constructor of your derived class, register an alternative class handler for . 不能通过重写 更改 的鼠标处理行为。You cannot change the mouse handling behavior of by overriding . 或者，您可以重写此方法，以便为特定的鼠标状态更改事件处理。Alternatively, you can override this method in order to change event handling for a specific mouse state. 是否选择调用基实现取决于方案。Whether you choose to call the base implementation depends on your scenario. 如果无法调用 base，则会禁用上级类上对该鼠标事件的默认输入处理，这也会要求调用 。Failing to call base disables default input handling for that mouse event on ancestor classes that also expect to invoke . 例如，你可以在派生类中派生 和重写 ，而无需调用 base;但是，此替代禁用控件上的上下文菜单服务，这是 默认行为的组成部分。For example, you can derive from and override in your derived class without calling base; however, this override disables the context menu services on your control, which are part of the default behavior. 在 .NET Framework 版本3.5 中引入。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies).

span.span: Implement this method to add class handling for this event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 鼠标按钮操作也由专用的输入管理器进行处理。Mouse button actions are also handled by a dedicated input manager. 依赖于鼠标按钮操作的其他编程功能（如输入和命令绑定）可能会调用操作的处理程序，然后才能将其作为常规鼠标按钮操作公开。Other programming features that rely on mouse button actions, such as input and command bindings, might invoke handlers for the action before it is exposed as a general mouse button action. 如果这些输入系统功能将 事件标记为 "已处理"，则不会调用 。If these input system features mark the event as handled, is not invoked. 如果使用此类处理程序将事件标记为已处理，则可能会影响以下事件： 和 。If you use this class handler to mark the event as handled, you potentially impact the following events: and . 接收到 时，可能会在接收元素上引发这些事件中的任何一个。Either of these events might be raised on the receiving element when is received. 如果将此事件标记为 "在类处理中处理"，则仍会引发 subevents;但是，它们将在事件数据中传递已处理状态。If you mark this event as handled in class handling, subevents are still raised; however, they pass the handled state in the event data. 如果事件是在类处理中处理的，则不会调用 subevents 的实例处理程序，除非你显式将 与 `handledEventsToo` `true` 结合使用才能附加处理程序。If the event is handled in class handling, instance handlers for the subevents are not invoked unless you explicitly use with `handledEventsToo` `true` in order to attach handlers. 类处理程序也不会被调用，除非这些类处理程序已注册到具有 `handledEventsToo` `true`的 签名。Class handlers also are not invoked unless those class handlers were registered with the signature with `handledEventsToo` `true`. 通过处理 ，你的类处理会考虑到所有可能的鼠标按钮向上操作。By handling , you are implying that your class handling accounted for all possible mouse button up actions. 此行为可能不是必需的。This behavior might be unwanted. 因此，使用此虚方法将事件标记为已处理时，请谨慎使用。Therefore, use caution when you use this virtual method to mark events as handled. 每个特定于按钮的直接事件还具有一个虚拟 On \* 方法;考虑是否可以更适当地重写这些按钮特定的类处理程序。Each of the button-specific direct events also has a virtual On\* method; consider whether overriding these button-specific class handlers might be more appropriate. 此方法没有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 因为继承中的中间类可能实现此方法，所以建议您在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 此方法的目的类似于 \* 方法上的 [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] 事件模式：此方法提供了通过建立类处理程序而不是实例处理程序来处理来自派生类的匹配事件的方法。The purpose of this method is similar to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event pattern On\* methods: this method provides the means to handle the matching event from derived classes by establishing a class handler instead of an instance handler. 在这种情况下，匹配事件是路由事件。In this case the matching event is a routed event. 对于路由事件，On \* 方法的实现模式是不同的，因为路由事件可以由子元素引发，这不一定是将调用处理程序的元素。The implementation pattern of the On\* methods is different for routed events because a routed event can be raised by a child element, which is not necessarily the element that will invoke handlers. 因此，您的实现需要检查事件数据的源属性。Therefore, your implementation needs to examine the source properties of the event data. 大多数情况下，它不应尝试 reraise 该事件。It should not try to reraise the event in most cases. 通过重写此方法或使用 注册类处理程序， 的派生类可以在事件路由收到事件时调用私有类处理程序方法。Either by overriding this method or by registering class handlers with , derived classes of can call private class handler methods when the event is received along the event route. 适用于类处理的一种情况是操作事件数据，并将路由事件标记为 "已处理"。One scenario where class handling is appropriate is to manipulate the event data and mark the routed event as handled. 在 .NET Framework 版本3.5 中引入。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies).

implementation pattern of the On\* methods is different for routed events because a routed event can be raised by a child element, which is not necessarily the element that will invoke handlers. 因此，您的实现需要检查事件数据的源属性。Therefore, your implementation needs to examine the source properties of the event data. 大多数情况下，它不应尝试 reraise 该事件。It should not try to reraise the event in most cases. 通过重写此方法或使用 注册类处理程序， 的派生类可以在事件路由收到事件时调用私有类处理程序方法。Either by overriding this method or by registering class handlers with , derived classes of can call private class handler methods when the event is received along the event route. 适用于类处理的一种情况是操作事件数据，并将路由事件标记为 "已处理"。One scenario where class handling is appropriate is to manipulate the event data and mark the routed event as handled. 专门用于预览事件的另一种方案是将其标记为已处理，以便不会调用匹配的冒泡类处理程序。Another scenario that is specifically for Preview events is to mark them handled so that the matching bubbling class handlers are not invoked. 在 .NET Framework 版本3.5 中引入。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies).

param.name: e

span.span: The that contains the event data.

param.span: 事件数据报告称已按下一个或多个鼠标按钮。

span.span: The event data reports that one or more mouse buttons were pressed.

summary.span: 当某个未处理的 附加路由事件在其路由中到达派生自此类的某个元素时调用。

span.span: Invoked when an unhandled attached routed event reaches an element in its route that is derived from this class.

summary.span: 实现此方法可为此事件添加类处理。

span.span: Implement this method to add class handling for this event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 鼠标按钮操作也由专用的输入管理器进行处理。Mouse button actions are also handled by a dedicated input manager. 依赖于鼠标按钮操作的其他编程功能（如输入和命令绑定）可能会调用操作的处理程序，然后才能将其作为常规鼠标按钮操作公开。Other programming features that rely on mouse button actions, such as input and command bindings, might invoke handlers for the action before it is exposed as a general mouse button action. 如果这些输入系统功能将 事件标记为 "已处理"，则不会调用 。If these input system features mark the event as handled, is not invoked. 如果使用此类处理程序将事件标记为已处理，则可能会影响以下事件： 和 。If you use this class handler to mark the event as handled, you potentially impact the following events: and . 接收到 时，可能会在接收元素上引发这些事件中的任何一个。Either of these events may be raised on the receiving element when is received. 如果将此事件标记为 "在类处理中处理"，则仍会引发 subevents;但是，它们将在事件数据中传递已处理状态。If you mark this event as handled in class handling, subevents are still raised; however, they pass the handled state in the event data. 如果事件是在类处理中处理的，则不会调用 subevents 的实例处理程序，除非你显式将 与 `handledEventsToo` `true` 结合使用才能附加处理程序。If the event is handled in class handling, instance handlers for the subevents are not invoked unless you explicitly use with `handledEventsToo` `true` in order to attach handlers. 类处理程序也不会被调用，除非这些类处理程序已注册到具有 `handledEventsToo` `true`的 签名。Class handlers also are not invoked unless those class handlers were registered with the signature with `handledEventsToo` `true`. 通过处理 ，你的类处理会考虑到所有可能的鼠标按钮按下操作。By handling , you are implying that your class handling accounted for all possible mouse button down actions. 此行为可能不是必需的。This behavior might be unwanted. 因此，使用此虚方法将事件标记为已处理时，请谨慎使用。Therefore, use caution when you use this virtual method to mark events as handled. 每个特定于按钮的直接事件还具有一个虚拟 On \* 方法;考虑是否可以更适当地重写这些按钮特定的类处理程序。Each of the button-specific direct events also has a virtual On\* method; consider whether overriding these button-specific class handlers might be more appropriate. 此方法没有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 因为继承中的中间类可能实现此方法，所以建议您在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 此方法的目的类似于 \* 方法上的 [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] 事件模式：此方法提供了通过建立类处理程序而不是实例处理程序来处理来自派生类的匹配事件的方法。The purpose of this method is similar to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event pattern On\* methods: this method provides the means to handle the matching event from derived classes by establishing a class handler instead of an instance handler. 在这种情况下，匹配事件是路由事件。In this case the matching event is a routed event. 对于路由事件，On \* 方法的实现模式是不同的，因为路由事件可以由子元素引发，这不一定是将调用处理程序的元素。The implementation pattern of the On\* methods is different for routed events because a routed event can be raised by a child element, which is not necessarily the element that will invoke handlers. 因此，您的实现需要检查事件数据的源属性。Therefore, your implementation needs to examine the source properties of the event data. 大多数情况下，它不应尝试 reraise 该事件。It should not try to reraise the event in most cases. 通过重写此方法或使用 注册类处理程序， 的派生类可以在事件路由收到事件时调用私有类处理程序方法。Either by overriding this method or by registering class handlers with , derived classes of can call private class handler methods when the event is received along the event route. 适用于类处理的一种情况是操作事件数据，并将路由事件标记为 "已处理"。One scenario where class handling is appropriate is to manipulate the event data and mark the routed event as handled. 专门用于预览事件的另一种方案是将其标记为已处理，以便不会调用匹配的冒泡类处理程序。Another scenario that is specifically for Preview events is to mark them handled so that the matching bubbling class handlers are not invoked. 在 .NET Framework remarks.format: ## Remarks "" 事件显示为传送隧道路由，但实际以间接方式传播。The event appears to travel a tunneling route but actually travels in an indirect way. 是作为隧道路由的基础事件，并且事件路由中的每个 使用相同的处理来引发直接路由事件 。 is the underlying event that is tunnel routed, and each along the event route uses identical handling to raise the direct routed event . 虽然您可以将 事件标记为为此元素的目的进行处理，但已处理状态并不会与事件路由中的其他元素保持。Although you can mark the event as handled for purposes of this element, the handled state does not perpetuate to other elements along the event route. 但是，你可能需要将事件标记为已处理，以防止调用常规实例处理程序（未指定 `handledEventsToo`）。However, you might want to mark the event as handled in order to prevent general instance handlers (those that did not specify `handledEventsToo`) from being invoked. 中的常规鼠标事件处理的默认实现侦听 并将其转换为适当的本地事件。The default implementation for general mouse event handling in listens for and converts it to an appropriate local event. 如果要重写此逻辑，必须创建派生类。If you want to override this logic, you must create a derived class. 在派生类的静态构造函数中，为 注册替代类处理程序。In the static constructor of your derived class, register an alternative class handler for . 不能通过重写 更改 的鼠标处理行为。You cannot change the mouse handling behavior of by overriding . 或者，您可以重写此方法，以便为特定的鼠标状态更改事件处理。Alternatively, you can override this method in order to change event handling for a specific mouse state. 是否选择调用基实现取决于方案。Whether you choose to call the base implementation depends on your scenario. 如果无法调用 base，则会禁用上级类上对该鼠标事件的默认输入处理，这也会要求调用 。Failing to call base disables default input handling for that mouse event on ancestor classes that also expect to invoke . 例如，你可以在派生类中派生 和重写 ，而无需调用基实现;但是，此替代禁用 事件。For example, you can derive from and override in your derived class without calling the base implementation; however, this override disables the event. 在 .NET Framework 版本3.5 中引入。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 鼠标按钮操作也由专用的输入管理器进行处理。Mouse button actions are also handled by a dedicated input manager. 依赖于鼠标按钮操作的其他编程功能（如输入和命令绑定）可能会调用操作的处理程序，然后才能将其作为常规鼠标按钮操作公开。Other programming features that rely on mouse button actions, such as input and command bindings, might invoke handlers for the action before it is exposed as a general mouse button action. 如果这些输入系统功能将 事件标记为 "已处理"，则不会调用 。If these input system features mark the event as handled, is not invoked. 如果使用此类处理程序将事件标记为已处理，则可能会影响以下事件： 和 。If you use this class handler to mark the event as handled, you potentially impact the following events: and . 接收到 时，可能会在接收元素上引发这些事件中的任何一个。Either of these events might be raised on the receiving element when is received. 如果将此事件标记为 "在类处理中处理"，则仍会引发 subevents;但是，它们将在事件数据中传递已处理状态。If you mark this event as handled in class handling, subevents are still raised; however, they pass the handled state in the event data. 如果事件是在类处理中处理的，则不会调用 subevents 的实例处理程序，除非你显式将 与 `handledEventsToo` `true` 结合使用才能附加处理程序。If the event is handled in class handling, instance handlers for the subevents are not invoked unless you explicitly use with `handledEventsToo` `true` in order to attach handlers. 类处理程序也不会被调用，除非这些类处理程序已注册到具有 `handledEventsToo` `true`的 签名。Class handlers also are not invoked unless those class handlers were registered with the signature with `handledEventsToo` `true`. 通过处理 ，你的类处理会考虑到所有可能的鼠标按钮向上操作。By handling , you are implying that your class handling accounted for all possible mouse button up actions. 此行为可能不是必需的。This behavior might be unwanted. 因此，使用此虚方法将事件标记为已处理时，请谨慎使用。Therefore, use caution when you use this virtual method to mark events as handled. 每个特定于按钮的直接事件还具有一个虚拟 On \* 方法;考虑是否可以更适当地重写这些按钮特定的类处理程序。Each of the button-specific direct events also has a virtual On\* method; remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法没有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 因为继承中的中间类可能实现此方法，所以建议您在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 此方法的目的类似于 \* 方法上的 [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] 事件模式：此方法提供了通过建立类处理程序而不是实例处理程序来处理来自派生类的匹配事件的方法。The purpose of this method is similar to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event pattern On\* methods: this method provides the means to handle the matching event from derived classes by establishing a class handler instead of an instance handler. 在这种情况下，匹配事件是路由事件。In this case the matching event is a routed event. 对于路由事件，On \* 方法的实现模式是不同的，因为路由事件可以由子元素引发，这不一定是将调用处理程序的元素。The implementation pattern of the On\* methods is different for routed events because a routed event can be raised by a child element, which is not necessarily the element that will invoke handlers. 因此，您的实现需要检查事件数据的源属性。Therefore, your implementation needs to examine the source properties of the event data. 大多数情况下，它不应尝试 reraise 该事件。It should not try to reraise the event in most cases. 通过重写此方法或使用 注册类处理程序， 的派生类可以在事件路由收到事件时调用私有类处理程序方法。Either by overriding this method or by registering class handlers with , derived classes of can call private class handler methods when the event is received along the event route. 适用于类处理的一种情况是操作事件数据，并将路由事件标记为 "已处理"。One scenario where class handling is appropriate is to manipulate the event data and mark the routed event as handled. 专门用于预览事件的另一种方案是将其标记为已处理，以便不会调用匹配的冒泡类处理程序。Another scenario that is specifically for Preview events is to mark them handled so that the matching bubbling class handlers are not invoked. 在 .NET Framework 版本3.5 中引入。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies).

span.span: Implement this method to add class handling for this event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法没有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 因为继承中的中间类可能实现此方法，所以建议您在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 此方法的目的类似于 \* 方法上的 [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] 事件模式：此方法提供了通过建立类处理程序而不是实例处理程序来处理来自派生类的匹配事件的方法。The purpose of this method is similar to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event pattern On\* methods: this method provides the means to handle the matching event from derived classes by establishing a class handler instead of an instance handler. 在这种情况下，匹配事件是路由事件。In this case the matching event is a routed event. 对于路由事件，On \* 方法的实现模式是不同的，因为路由事件可以由子元素引发，这不一定是将调用处理程序的元素。The implementation pattern of the On\* methods is different for routed events because a routed event can be raised by a child element, which is not necessarily the element that will invoke handlers. 因此，您的实现需要检查事件数据的源属性。Therefore, your implementation needs to examine the source properties of the event data. 大多数情况下，它不应尝试 reraise 该事件。It should not try to reraise the event in most cases. 通过重写此方法或使用 注册类处理程序， 的派生类可以在事件路由收到事件时调用私有类处理程序方法。Either by overriding this method or by registering class handlers with , derived classes of can call private class handler methods when the event is received along the event route. 适用于类处理的一种情况是操作事件数据，并将路由事件标记为 "已处理"。One scenario where class handling is appropriate is to manipulate the event data and mark the routed event as handled. 专门用于预览事件的另一种方案是将其标记为已处理，以便不会调用匹配的冒泡类处理程序。Another scenario that is specifically for Preview events is to mark them handled so that the matching bubbling class handlers are not invoked. 在 .NET Framework 版本3.5 中引入。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法没有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 因为继承中的中间类可能实现此方法，所以建议您在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 此方法的目的类似于 \* 方法上的 [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] 事件模式：此方法提供了通过建立类处理程序而不是实例处理程序来处理来自派生类的匹配事件的方法。The purpose of this method is similar to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event pattern On\* methods: this method provides the means to handle the matching event from derived classes by establishing a class handler instead of an instance handler. 在这种情况下，匹配事件是路由事件。In this case the matching event is a routed event. 对于路由事件，On \* 方法的实现模式是不同的，因为路由事件可以由子元素引发，这不一定是将调用处理程序的元素。The implementation pattern of the On\* methods is different for routed events because a routed event can be raised by a child element, which is not necessarily the element that will invoke handlers. 因此，您的实现需要检查事件数据的源属性。Therefore, your implementation needs to examine the source properties of the event data. 大多数情况下，它不应尝试 reraise 该事件。It should not try to reraise the event in most cases. 通过重写此方法或使用 注册类处理程序， 的派生类可以在事件路由收到事件时调用私有类处理程序方法。Either by overriding this method or by registering class handlers with , derived classes of can call private class handler methods when the event is received along the event route. 适用于类处理的一种情况是操作事件数据，并将路由事件标记为 "已处理"。One scenario where class handling is appropriate is to manipulate the event data and mark the routed event as handled. 在 .NET Framework 版本3.5 中引入。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法没有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 因为继承中的中间类可能实现此方法，所以建议您在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 您可以根据自己的要求，在特殊处理之前或之后调用 base。You may call base either before or after your special handling, depending on your requirements. 此方法的目的类似于 \* 方法 [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] 事件模式：此方法提供了通过建立类处理程序而不是实例处理程序来处理来自派生类的匹配事件的方法。The purpose of this method is similar to [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event pattern On\* methods: this method provides the means to handle the matching event from derived classes by establishing a class handler instead of an instance handler. 在这种情况下，匹配事件是路由事件。In this case the matching event is a routed event. 将事件标记为已处理仍然有助于防止调用典型的实例处理程序（未指定 `handledEventsToo`）。Marking the event as handled is still useful for preventing typical instance handlers (those that do not specify `handledEventsToo`) from being invoked. 在 .NET Framework 版本3.5 中引入。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies).

span.span: Implement this method to add class handling for this event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法没有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 因为继承中的中间类可能实现此方法，所以建议您在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 此方法的目的类似于 \* 方法上的 [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] 事件模式：此方法提供了通过建立类处理程序而不是实例处理程序来处理来自派生类的匹配事件的方法。The purpose of this method is similar to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event pattern On\* methods: this method provides the means to handle the matching event from derived classes by establishing a class handler instead of an instance handler. 在这种情况下，匹配事件是路由事件。In this case the matching event is a routed event. 对于路由事件，On \* 方法的实现模式是不同的，因为路由事件可以由子元素引发，这不一定是将调用处理程序的元素。The implementation pattern of the On\* methods is different for routed events because a routed event can be raised by a child element, which is not necessarily the element that will invoke handlers. 因此，您的实现需要检查事件数据的源属性。Therefore, your implementation needs to examine the source properties of the event data. 大多数情况下，它不应尝试 reraise 该事件。It should not try to reraise the event in most cases. 通过重写此方法或使用 注册类处理程序， 的派生类可以在事件路由收到事件时调用私有类处理程序方法。Either by overriding this method or by registering class handlers with , derived classes of can call private class handler methods when the event is received along the event route. 适用于类处理的一种情况是操作事件数据，并将路由事件标记为 "已处理"。One scenario where class handling is appropriate is to manipulate the event data and mark the routed event as handled. 在 .NET Framework 版本3.5 中引入。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 从 类派生类时，可以将此方法与 方法一起使用，以刷新元素的模型。When you derive a class from the class, you can use this method together with the method to refresh the model of the element. 只需在高级方案中调用此方法。You only need to call this method in advanced scenarios. 如果派生类具有多个影响外观的属性，并且您希望只更新基础模型一次，则这种高级方案就是这样。One such advanced scenario is if the derived class has multiple properties that affect the appearance, and you want to update the underlying model only once. 在 方法中，你可以更新 类的 属性。Within the method you could update the property of the class. 此方法在 类中没有默认实现。This method has no default implementation in the class. 在 .NET Framework 版本3.5 中引入。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies). ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何从 类派生，以创建 `Sphere` 类：The following example shows how to derive from the class to create a `Sphere` class: [!code-csharp[Shapes#Sphere](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/Shapes/CSharp/Sphere.cs#sphere)] [!code-vb[Shapes#Sphere](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/Shapes/visualbasic/sphere.vb#sphere)] 有关完整示例，请参阅[UIElement3D 球体示例](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=160044)。For the complete sample, see [UIElement3D Sphere Sample](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=160044).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在注册路由事件时创建路由事件标识符。Routed event identifiers are created when routed events are registered. 这些标识符包含标识名称、所有者类型、处理程序类型、路由策略和、添加事件所有者的实用程序方法。These identifiers contain an identifying name, owner type, handler type, routing strategy, and utility method for adding owners for the event. 可以使用这些标识符添加类处理程序。You can use these identifiers to add class handlers. 有关注册路由的事件的详细信息，请参阅 。For more information about registering routed events, see . 有关使用路由事件标识符添加类处理程序的详细信息，请参阅 。For more information about using routed event identifiers to add class handlers, see . 在 .NET Framework 版本3.5 中引入。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此事件创建此类的 附加事件的别名，以便在将 作为基元素继承时， 是类成员列表的一部分。This event creates an alias for the attached event for this class, so that is part of the class members list when is inherited as a base element. 附加到 事件的事件处理程序附加到基础 附加事件，并接收相同的事件数据实例。Event handlers that are attached to the event are attached to the underlying attached event and receive the same event data instance. 事件通常与 或 一起引发，这对应于按下这两个标准鼠标按钮之一。The event is often raised together with either or , which correspond to a press of one of the two standard mouse buttons. 和 也是路由事件，但它们是直接路由事件，当 事件沿事件路由到达此元素时，将引发相应的按钮特定的事件。 and are also routed events, but they are direct routed events, and the appropriate button-specific event is raised when the event reaches this element along the event route. 有关 或 ，请参阅 "备注"。See Remarks for or . 在 .NET Framework 版本3.5 中引入。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies). ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|隧道Tunneling| |委托Delegate|| - 对应的冒泡事件 。The corresponding bubbling event is . - 重写 在派生类中实现此事件的类处理。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Custom Event PreviewMouseLeftButtonDown As MouseButtonEventHandler

summary.span: 在鼠标指针位于此元素上并且按下鼠标左键时发生。

span.span: Occurs when the left mouse button is pressed while the mouse pointer is over this element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 尽管此[路由事件概述](/dotnet/framework/wpf/advanced/routed-events-overview)看起来是通过元素树跟踪隧道路由，但实际上它是一个直接路由事件，每个 都会沿着元素树引发并 reraised 该事件。Although this [Routed Events Overview](/dotnet/framework/wpf/advanced/routed-events-overview) seems to follow a tunneling route through an element tree, it actually is a direct routed event that is raised and reraised along the element tree by each . 此事件是多个相关事件之一，用于报告基础 事件的鼠标按钮细节，该事件是由事件路由中的每个元素处理的附加事件。This event is one of several related events that report the mouse-button specifics of an underlying event, which is an attached event that is processed by each element along an event route. 此事件的事件数据公开基础 事件的事件数据。The event data of this event exposes the event data of the underlying event. 如果该事件在事件路由中标记为 "已处理"，则仍会引发鼠标按钮特定的事件;但是，必须通过显式调用 来添加鼠标按钮特定事件的处理程序，并且可以选择处理已标记为已处理的事件，以便作为事件的侦听器。If that event is marked as handled along the event route, the mouse-button specific events are still raised; however, handlers of the mouse-button specific events must be added by explicitly calling , with the option to handle events that are already marked as handled, in order to be listeners to the event. 如果将 标记为 "已处理"，则实质上是将为沿着路由的所有其他侦听器和所有相关事件标记 处理。If you mark handled, you are essentially marking handled for all further listeners along the route, and on all related events. 这可能包括类处理程序生成的事件，例如 。This possibly includes class-handler generated events such as . 从概念上讲，将此事件（以及 上的其他鼠标按钮事件）视为鼠标 "服务" （使用 类提供的服务定义）。Conceptually, think of this event (and other mouse-button events on ) to be a mouse "service" (with the service definition provided by the class). 事件增加了不需要在事件数据中检查鼠标按钮状态（从左到右、向下）的原始鼠标事件的便利。The event adds the convenience of not needing to check the mouse button states (left-right, up-down) of the original mouse events in the event data. 对于更高级的方案，如检查非标准按钮的状态，可能需要使用 类上的 Api，而不是 上的 Api。For more advanced scenarios, such as checking for states of non-standard buttons, you might need to use the APIs on the class rather than those on . 在 .NET Framework 版本3.5 中引入。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies). ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|直接Direct| |委托Delegate|| - 重写 在派生类中实现此事件的类处理。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在注册路由事件时创建路由事件标识符。Routed event identifiers are created when routed events are registered. 这些标识符包含标识名称、所有者类型、处理程序类型、路由策略和、添加事件所有者的实用程序方法。These identifiers contain an identifying name, owner type, handler type, routing strategy, and utility method for adding owners for the event. 可以使用这些标识符添加类处理程序。You can use these identifiers to add class handlers. 有关注册路由的事件的详细信息，请参阅 。For more information about registering routed events, see . 有关使用路由事件标识符添加类处理程序的详细信息，请参阅 。For more information about using routed event identifiers to add class handlers, see . 在 .NET Framework 版本3.5 中引入。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies).

MemberSignature.Value: Public Custom Event PreviewMouseLeftButtonUp As MouseButtonEventHandler

summary.span: 在鼠标指针位于此元素上并且松开鼠标左键时发生。

span.span: Occurs when the left mouse button is released while the mouse pointer is over this element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 尽管此[路由事件概述](/dotnet/framework/wpf/advanced/routed-events-overview)看起来是通过元素树跟踪隧道路由，但实际上它是一个直接路由事件，每个 都会沿着元素树引发并 reraised 该事件。Although this [Routed Events Overview](/dotnet/framework/wpf/advanced/routed-events-overview) seems to follow a tunneling route through an element tree, it actually is a direct routed event that is raised and reraised along the element tree by each . 此事件是多个相关事件之一，用于报告基础 事件的鼠标按钮细节，该事件是由事件路由中的每个元素处理的附加事件。This event is one of several related events that report the mouse-button specifics of an underlying event, which is an attached event that is processed by each element along an event route. 此事件的事件数据公开基础 事件的事件数据。The event data of this event exposes the event data of the underlying event. 如果该事件在事件路由中标记为 "已处理"，则仍会引发鼠标按钮特定的事件;但是，必须通过显式调用 来添加鼠标按钮特定事件的处理程序，并且可以选择处理已标记为已处理的事件，以便作为事件的侦听器。If that event is marked as handled along the event route, the mouse-button specific events are still raised; however, handlers of the mouse-button specific events must be added by explicitly calling , with the option to handle events that are already marked as handled, in order to be listeners to the event. 如果将 标记为 "已处理"，则实质上是将为沿着路由的所有其他侦听器和所有相关事件标记 处理。If you mark handled, you are essentially marking handled for all further listeners along the route, and on all related events. 从概念上讲，将此事件（以及 上的其他鼠标按钮事件）视为鼠标 "服务" （使用 类提供的服务定义）。Conceptually, think of this event (and other mouse-button events on ) to be a mouse "service" (with the service definition provided by the class). 事件增加了不需要在事件数据中检查鼠标按钮状态（从左到右、向下）的原始鼠标事件的便利。The event adds the convenience of not needing to check the mouse button states (left-right, up-down) of the original mouse events in the event data. 对于更高级的方案，如检查非标准按钮的状态，可能需要使用 类上的 Api，而不是 上的 Api。For more advanced scenarios, such as checking for states of non-standard buttons, you might need to use the APIs on the class rather than those on . 在 .NET Framework 版本3.5 中引入。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies). ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|直接Direct| |委托Delegate|| - 重写 在派生类中实现此事件的类处理。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

summary.span: 在鼠标指针位于此元素上并且移动鼠标指针时发生。

span.span: Occurs when the mouse pointer moves while the mouse pointer is over this element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 当鼠标指针第一次进入元素边界时，以及当鼠标指针移动到元素边界内时，将发生此事件。This event occurs both when the mouse pointer first enters into the element bounds, and also when the mouse pointer moves while still remaining within the element bounds. 此事件创建此类的 附加事件的别名，以便在将 作为基元素继承时， 是类成员列表的一部分。This event creates an alias for the attached event for this class, so that is part of the class members list when is inherited as a base element. 附加到 事件的事件处理程序附加到基础 附加事件，并接收相同的事件数据实例。Event handlers that are attached to the event are attached to the underlying attached event and receive the same event data instance. 在 .NET Framework 版本3.5 中引入。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies). ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|隧道Tunneling| |委托Delegate|| - 对应的冒泡事件 。The corresponding bubbling event is . - 重写 在派生类中实现此事件的类处理。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

span.span: Occurs when the user rotates the mouse wheel while the mouse pointer is over this element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 焦点或鼠标捕获优先于鼠标指针所在的位置;因此，如果从焦点或捕获的元素接收此事件，则鼠标指针实际上可能位于另一个元素上。Focus or mouse capture take precedence over where the mouse pointer is; therefore, if you receive this event from a focused or captured element, the mouse pointer might actually be over another element. 此事件创建此类的 附加事件的别名，以便在将 作为基元素继承时， 是类成员列表的一部分。This event creates an alias for the attached event for this class, so that is part of the class members list when is inherited as a base element. 附加到 事件的事件处理程序附加到基础 附加事件，并接收相同的事件数据实例。Event handlers that are attached to the event are attached to the underlying attached event and receive the same event data instance. 在 .NET Framework 版本3.5 中引入。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies). ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|隧道Tunneling| |委托Delegate|| - 对应的冒泡事件 。The corresponding bubbling event is . - 重写 在派生类中实现此事件的类处理。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

summary.span: 在拖放操作期间键盘或鼠标按钮的状态改变时发生。

span.span: Occurs when there is a change in the keyboard or mouse button state during a drag-and-drop operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 事件允许拖动源声明是否应取消拖放操作。The event enables the drag source to declare whether the drag-and-drop operation should be canceled. 此事件创建此类的 附加事件的别名，以便在将 作为基元素继承时， 是类成员列表的一部分。This event creates an alias for the attached event for this class, so that is part of the class members list when is inherited as a base element. 附加到 事件的事件处理程序附加到基础 附加事件，并接收相同的事件数据实例。Event handlers that are attached to the event are attached to the underlying attached event and receive the same event data instance. 在 .NET Framework 版本3.5 中引入。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies). ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|隧道Tunneling| |委托Delegate|| - 对应的冒泡事件 。The corresponding bubbling event is . - 重写 在派生类中实现此事件的类处理。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 默认情况下，在手指触摸屏幕并移动之前，不会发生 和 事件。By default, the and events do not occur until a finger touches the screen and moves. 在屏幕上按一根手指而不移动它会导致 的按压行为。Pressing a finger on the screen and holding it without moving it causes the press and hold behavior of a . 按住行为等效于鼠标右键单击。The press and hold behavior is equivalent to a mouse right-click. 若要使 和 事件在手指触摸屏幕时立即发生，请将 附加属性设置为此元素的 `false`。To cause the and events to occur as soon as a finger touches the screen, set the attached property to `false` for this element. ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|隧道Tunneling| |委托Delegate|类型。 of type .| - 对应的冒泡事件 。The corresponding bubbling event is . - 重写 在派生类中实现此事件的类处理。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Custom Event QueryCursor As QueryCursorEventHandler

summary.span: 当请求显示光标时发生。

span.span: Occurs when the cursor is requested to display.

summary.span: 每次鼠标指针移至新位置时都会在一个元素上引发此事件，这意味着光标对象可能需要根据其新位置进行更改。

span.span: This event is raised on an element each time that the mouse pointer moves to a new location, which means the cursor object might need to be changed based on its new position.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此事件创建此类的 附加事件的别名，以便在将 作为基元素继承时， 是类成员列表的一部分。This event creates an alias for the attached event for this class, so that is part of the class members list when is inherited as a base element. 附加到 事件的事件处理程序附加到基础 附加事件，并接收相同的事件数据实例。Event handlers that are attached to the event are attached to the underlying attached event and receive the same event data instance. 此事件名称所引用的游标不一定是文本光标（有时也称为插入点）。The cursor being referred to by this event name is not necessarily the text cursor (sometimes known as the insertion point). 相反，此上下文中的光标是一个对象，该对象声明与 Windows 编程中几个可能的输入相关设备或概念相关的屏幕图形显示。Instead, the cursor in this context is the object that declares the onscreen graphical display related to several possible input-related devices or concepts in Windows programming. 该对象由 WPF 中的 类表示。That object is represented by the class in WPF. WPF 输入系统使你可以在其表示鼠标指针的屏幕位置时更改此光标。The WPF input system enables you to change this cursor when it represents the onscreen position of the mouse pointer. 可以从 枚举使用预定义的值，也可以将自定义游标声明为映像文件。You can use predefined values from the enumeration, or you can declare a custom cursor as an image file. 侦听 事件不是游标管理的有效方法。Listening for the event is not an efficient technique for cursor management. 相反，每个元素都应该定义自己的具有 和 的游标行为。Instead, each element should define its own cursor behavior with and . 仅当未使用 WPF 框架级别的基元素时，或在基于每个元素定义游标行为的特殊情况下，你应依赖于 ，这不能满足你的需求。You should only rely on if you are not using the WPF framework-level base elements, or in extraordinary circumstances where defining cursor behavior on a per-element basis does not meet your needs. 有关实现游标行为以响应 的详细信息，请参阅 。For more information on implementing cursor behavior in response to , see . 在 .NET Framework 版本3.5 中引入。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies). ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|冒泡Bubbling| |委托Delegate|| - 未定义相应的隧道事件。There is no defined corresponding tunneling event. - 重写 在派生类中实现此事件的类处理。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

summary.span: 在提供的 实例内标识将引发的 （作为该事件数据的 属性）。

span.span: The to be raised is identified within the instance that is provided (as the property of that event data).

remarks.format: ## Remarks `e` 参数类型化为所有路由事件数据的通用基类型;但是，应将事件数据指定为可用于引发事件的最特定事件数据类型，因为 派生类包含用于引发特定事件的实际特定数据属性。The `e` parameter is typed as the common base type for all routed event data; however, the event data should be given as the most specific event data type that is available for the event being raised, because derived classes contain the actual specific data properties that are intended for the specific event when it is raised. 不只是事件的状态属性;它还标识要引发的路由事件。 is not just the state properties for the event; it also identifies which routed event to raise. 此事件引发模式和路由事件数据都不同于 [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] 事件和数据类，它们通常只包含与事件相关的属性。This event-raising pattern and the routed event data both differ from [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] events and data classes, which typically just contain properties that are related to the event. 在 .NET Framework 版本3.5 中引入。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies).

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void RemoveHandler(class System.Windows.RoutedEvent routedEvent, class System.Delegate handler) cil managed
Public Sub RemoveHandler (routedEvent As RoutedEvent, handler As Delegate)
public: virtual void RemoveHandler(System::Windows::RoutedEvent ^ routedEvent, Delegate ^ handler);
abstract member RemoveHandler : System.Windows.RoutedEvent * Delegate -> unit override this.RemoveHandler : System.Windows.RoutedEvent * Delegate -> unit

param.name: routedEvent
param.span: 附加了处理程序的路由事件的标识符。

span.span: The identifier of the routed event for which the handler is attached.

param.name: handler
param.span: 要从此元素的事件处理程序集合中删除的特定处理程序实现。

span.span: The specific handler implementation to remove from the event handler collection on this element.

summary.span: 从此元素中删除指定的路由事件处理程序。

span.span: Removes the specified routed event handler from this element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用此 API 的最常见方案是实现与自定义路由事件相关联的 [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] "包装" 事件，特别是在 [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_clr](~/includes/tla2sharptla-clr-md.md)] 级别实现处理程序的 "删除" 逻辑时。The most common scenario for using this API is when you implement the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] "wrapper" event that is associated with a custom routed event, specifically when you implement the "remove" logic for handlers at the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_clr](~/includes/tla2sharptla-clr-md.md)] level. 如果没有向与方法调用的输入参数匹配的条件注册处理程序，则调用此方法将不起作用。Calling this method has no effect if there were no handlers registered with criteria that match the input parameters for the method call. 如果附加了多个与条件相匹配的处理程序，则只会删除事件处理程序存储中的第一个处理程序。If more than one handler is attached that matched the criteria, only the first handler in the event handler store is removed. 此行为与 `-=` 运算符 [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_clr](~/includes/tla2sharptla-clr-md.md)] 行为一致。This behavior is consistent with [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_clr](~/includes/tla2sharptla-clr-md.md)] behavior of the `-=` operator. `routedEvent` 和 `handler` 均无法 `null`。Neither `routedEvent` nor `handler` may be `null`. 尝试将任一值作为 `null` 提供会引发异常。Attempting to provide either value as `null` will raise an exception. 此方法将忽略 `handledEventsToo` 参数信息，如果处理程序是第一次用允许处理已处理事件的 签名添加的，则提供此方法。This method ignores the `handledEventsToo` parameter information, which is provided if the handler was first added with the signature that enables handling of already-handled events. 已删除任一类型的处理程序。Either type of handler is removed. 在 .NET Framework 版本3.5 中引入。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果本地设置 ，这将返回 `true`。This will return `true` if is locally set. 提供此 `ShouldSerialize` 方法的原因是 属性没有简单的默认值。This `ShouldSerialize` method is provided because the property does not have a simple default value. 此方法指示属性是否已更改为其默认值。This method indicates whether the property has changed from its default value. 如果要开发设计器或开发自己的包含 的控件，通常会调用此方法。You typically invoke this method if you are either developing a designer or developing your own control incorporating a . 有关详细信息，请参阅[用 ShouldSerialize 和 Reset 方法定义默认值](/dotnet/framework/winforms/controls/defining-default-values-with-the-shouldserialize-and-reset-methods)。For more information, see [Defining Default Values with the ShouldSerialize and Reset Methods](/dotnet/framework/winforms/controls/defining-default-values-with-the-shouldserialize-and-reset-methods). 在 .NET Framework 版本3.5 中引入。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此事件创建此类的 附加事件的别名，以便在将 作为基元素继承时， 是类成员列表的一部分。This event creates an alias for the attached event for this class, so that is part of the class members list when is inherited as a base element. 附加到 事件的事件处理程序附加到基础 附加事件，并接收相同的事件数据实例。Event handlers that are attached to the event are attached to the underlying attached event and receive the same event data instance. 触摸、鼠标和触笔输入在特定关系中存在。Touch, mouse, and stylus input exist in a particular relationship. 有关详细信息，请参阅[Windows Vista 中的触摸输入支持](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=160818)和[输入概述](/dotnet/framework/wpf/advanced/input-overview)。For more information, see [Touch Input Support in Windows Vista](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=160818) and [Input Overview](/dotnet/framework/wpf/advanced/input-overview). 在 .NET Framework 版本3.5 中引入。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies). ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|冒泡Bubbling| |委托Delegate|| - 对应的隧道事件 。The corresponding tunneling event is . - 重写 在派生类中实现此事件的类处理。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

summary.span: 在触笔进入此元素的边界时发生。

span.span: Occurs when the stylus enters the bounds of this element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 是使用直接事件处理路由策略的[路由事件概述](/dotnet/framework/wpf/advanced/routed-events-overview)。 is a [Routed Events Overview](/dotnet/framework/wpf/advanced/routed-events-overview) that uses the direct event handling routing strategy. 直接路由事件不沿路由引发;相反，它们是在引发它们的同一元素中进行处理的。Direct routed events are not raised along a route; instead, they are handled in the same element where they are raised. 但是，它们会启用路由事件行为的其他方面，如样式中的事件触发器。However, they do enable other aspects of routed event behavior, such as event triggers in styles. 尽管 在触笔进入元素边界时进行跟踪，但此事件更确切地报告 属性值已从 `false` 更改为此元素上的 `true`。Although tracks when the stylus enters the bounds of an element, this event more literally reports that the property value has changed from `false` to `true` on this element. 此事件创建此类的 附加事件的别名，以便在将 作为基元素继承时， 是类成员列表的一部分。This event creates an alias for the attached event for this class, so that is part of the class members list when is inherited as a base element. 附加到 事件的事件处理程序附加到基础 附加事件，并接收相同的事件数据实例。Event handlers that are attached to the event are attached to the underlying attached event and receive the same event data instance. 触摸、鼠标和触笔输入在特定关系中存在。Touch, mouse, and stylus input exist in a particular relationship. 有关详细信息，请参阅[Windows Vista 中的触摸输入支持](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=160818)和[输入概述](/dotnet/framework/wpf/advanced/input-overview)。For more information, see [Touch Input Support in Windows Vista](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=160818) and [Input Overview](/dotnet/framework/wpf/advanced/input-overview). 在 .NET Framework 版本3.5 中引入。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies). ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|直接Direct| |委托Delegate|| - 重写 在派生类中实现此事件的类处理。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此事件创建此类的 附加事件的别名，以便在将 作为基元素继承时， 是类成员列表的一部分。This event creates an alias for the attached event for this class, so that is part of the class members list when is inherited as a base element. 附加到 事件的事件处理程序附加到基础 附加事件，并接收相同的事件数据实例。Event handlers that are attached to the event are attached to the underlying attached event and receive the same event data instance. 触摸、鼠标和触笔输入在特定关系中存在。Touch, mouse, and stylus input exist in a particular relationship. 有关详细信息，请参阅[Windows Vista 中的触摸输入支持](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=160818)和[输入概述](/dotnet/framework/wpf/advanced/input-overview)。For more information, see [Touch Input Support in Windows Vista](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=160818) and [Input Overview](/dotnet/framework/wpf/advanced/input-overview). 在 .NET Framework 版本3.5 中引入。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies). ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|冒泡Bubbling| |委托Delegate|| - 对应的隧道事件 。The corresponding tunneling event is . - 重写 在派生类中实现此事件的类处理。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

summary.span: 在触笔离开元素的边界时发生。

span.span: Occurs when the stylus leaves the bounds of the element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 是使用直接事件处理路由策略的[路由事件概述](/dotnet/framework/wpf/advanced/routed-events-overview)。 is a [Routed Events Overview](/dotnet/framework/wpf/advanced/routed-events-overview) that uses the direct event handling routing strategy. 直接路由事件不沿路由引发;相反，它们是在引发它们的同一元素中进行处理的。Direct routed events are not raised along a route; instead, they are handled in the same element where they are raised. 但是，它们会启用路由事件行为的其他方面，如样式中的事件触发器。However, they do enable other aspects of routed event behavior, such as event triggers in styles. 尽管 在触笔离开元素边界时进行跟踪，但此事件更准确地报告 属性值已从 `true` 更改为此元素上的 `false`。Although tracks when the stylus leaves the bounds of an element, this event more literally reports that the property value has changed from `true` to `false` on this element. 此事件创建此类的 附加事件的别名，以便在将 作为基元素继承时， 是类成员列表的一部分。This event creates an alias for the attached event for this class, so that is part of the class members list when is inherited as a base element. 附加到 事件的事件处理程序附加到基础 附加事件，并接收相同的事件数据实例。Event handlers that are attached to the event are attached to the underlying attached event and receive the same event data instance. 触摸、鼠标和触笔输入在特定关系中存在。Touch, mouse, and stylus input exist in a particular relationship. 有关详细信息，请参阅[Windows Vista 中的触摸输入支持](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=160818)和[输入概述](/dotnet/framework/wpf/advanced/input-overview)。For more information, see [Touch Input Support in Windows Vista](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=160818) and [Input Overview](/dotnet/framework/wpf/advanced/input-overview). 在 .NET Framework 版本3.5 中引入。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies). ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|直接Direct| |委托Delegate|| - 重写 在派生类中实现此事件的类处理。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

summary.span: 在此元素以设备无关模式获取文本时发生。

span.span: Occurs when this element gets text in a device-independent manner.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 事件允许组件或应用程序以与设备无关的方式侦听文本输入。The event allows a component or application to listen for text input in a device-independent manner. 键盘是 的主要方式，但语音、手写和其他输入设备也会引发 。The keyboard is the primary means of , but speech, handwriting, and other input devices can also raise . 由于键组合（在默认键盘或通过输入法编辑器）中，多个键事件可能只引发一个文本输入事件。Because of key combinations - either in default keyboards or through input method editors - multiple key events might raise just one text input event. 此事件创建此类的 附加事件的别名，以便在将 作为基元素继承时， 是类成员列表的一部分。This event creates an alias for the attached event for this class, so that is part of the class members list when is inherited as a base element. 附加到 事件的事件处理程序附加到基础 附加事件，并接收相同的事件数据实例。Event handlers that are attached to the event are attached to the underlying attached event and receive the same event data instance. 在 .NET Framework 版本3.5 中引入。 is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. 有关详细信息，请参见[版本和依赖关系](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies)。For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](/dotnet/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies). ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|冒泡Bubbling| |委托Delegate|| - 对应的隧道事件 。The corresponding tunneling event is . - 重写 在派生类中实现此事件的类处理。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

summary.span: 当悬停在此元素上方的手指触摸屏幕时发生。

span.span: Occurs when a finger touches the screen while the finger is over this element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 默认情况下，在手指触摸屏幕并移动之前，不会发生 和 事件。By default, the and events do not occur until a finger touches the screen and moves. 在屏幕上按一根手指而不移动它会导致 的按压行为。Pressing a finger on the screen and holding it without moving it causes the press and hold behavior of a . 按住行为等效于鼠标右键单击。The press and hold behavior is equivalent to a mouse right-click. 若要使 和 事件在手指触摸屏幕时立即发生，请将 附加属性设置为此元素的 `false`。To cause the and events to occur as soon as a finger touches the screen, set the attached property to `false` for this element. ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|冒泡Bubbling| |委托Delegate|类型。 of type .| - 对应的隧道事件 。The corresponding tunneling event is . - 重写 在派生类中实现此事件的类处理。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.
